research_projects.title: Development of Core Technologies for Robot-Friendly Building Design, Construction, Operation & Management
research_projects.description: The project marks the first phase of the national Smart+ Building R&D plan, targeting service-robot operation inside healthcare and terminal environments. BIM pipelines feed Unity and ROS simulations, enabling early collision-avoidance and path-planning tests before on-site deployment.
objectives: Publish robot-friendly spatial & component design standards
Build a multi-robot orchestration and indoor positioning platform
Run full-scale pilot tests at Gangdong Kyung Hee University Hospital and other facilities

research_projects.title: BIM-Based Customer-Friendly AI Automated Cost Estimation System for Industrialized Construction
research_projects.description: This project focuses on developing an AI-powered cost estimation system that integrates with BIM workflows to provide accurate and customer-friendly cost estimates for modular and industrialized construction projects. The system aims to achieve ±3% estimation accuracy and reduce construction cost errors by up to 20%.
objectives: AI-based unit price and labor cost learning

research_projects.title: AI-Based Automated Architectural Design Technology Development
research_projects.role: Researcher (NLP model tuning & BIM database engineering)
research_projects.funding_source: National Land Infrastructure & Transport Technology Programme
research_projects.description: The consortium is integrating AI with BIM to shorten the concept-design cycle. Maintaining the MongoDB-backed design corpus and fine-tuning transformer models that map client intents to spatial constraints, pushing text-to-BIM workflows toward commercial readiness. Project completed across 5 phases (2021-2025).
objectives: Convert free-text client briefs to BIM-ready design options using BERT-based NLP and generative models
Automate design-performance evaluation and option ranking

research_projects.title: Open BIM-Based Automated Code Compliance Checking Technology & Applications
research_projects.description: This completed project established Korea's first open-BIM rule-checking workflow. Contributions centered on mapping IFC entities to rule parameters and building regression test suites that now serve as benchmarks for the newer Smart+ Building regulatory modules.
objectives: Translate Korean Building Code clauses into executable IFC logic rules
Develop KBim Assess-Lite model checker and KBim D-Generator for automatic 2D permit drawings
